page.title: 18CHOLWICH TOWN FARM.
page.content: Cholwich Town has never been a town as we might imagine with shops and factories.The word town is a form of the old English 'tun',meaning farm. This farm has been here since 1204, over 750 years,although it has been added to over the centuries.Although it is being encroached upon by the Cholwichtown waste tip,its historical importance should preserve it for the future.The house has been altered over the centuries and has a number of staircases,deep cupboards and winding passages.At one time the farm did belong to the Cholwich family but by the 1870's all the land had been dispersed,leaving only the farm name. The hill under which it is situated gives some protection from the cold wind in winter and a spring still runs past the farm.At present the farm is unoccupied.
